reviews.title: a wonderful little hotel
reviews.text: my husband and i just came from 2 weeks in playa del carmen. we stayed at the Riveria Caribe Maya hotel. the hotel was spotless, our room was just perfect. the air conditioner blew cold, the staff friendly andhelpful and the maids worked very hard to make sure your room was great. it was also a short walk to the beach and 5th avenue. carol cole. old hickory tennessee

reviews.title: Best ever tour from this hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the riviera caribe maya in january and the reviews to this hotel are right on and everthing has been said on this hotel, but we took the most amazing tour from this hotel called the Sacred Blue by tour guide Pato...the 1st part of the trip was a trip to a cenote and we were the only ones there...Pato gave us snorkeling lessons which we needed and we dropped into the crystal clear water and could see to the bottom of the cenote...we were the only ones there at the time and it was so incredible, peaceful and beautiful...amazing... then off to an underground river, cave and cenote which is where the tour gets its name...as you descend into the cave...you walk up the underground river and come to a clearing where you can see the cenote in the distance and it is beautifully blue with the sunlight filtering down into the cave...mayan mystical magic!...it is moderatedly rugged and there are places where you have to bend way down to get through the narrow passages, but when you get to the cenote it is so amazing and beautiful...there is even a rope for jumping in...my husband is 60 years old and he made it with little difficulty.. after you finish you have lunch with a mayan family who take care of this jungle retreat and it is just a wonderful experience...the next part of the trip was snorkeling at akumal bay which is where we saw all of the wonderful fish...this is probably the best trip we have ever taken and an experience our family will never forget...please if you have a chance to go on the sacred blue tour from the hotel...do it...I cant recommend it enough!

Just got back from this cute hotel and we really liked it. Its a short walk to Mamitas Beach located at calle 28. The hotel gives you a ticket for use of two chairs and an umbrella along with nice beach towels to bring with. The rooms have a refrigerator stocked with water and pop which costs 130 pesos or $1.30. This property is quite a walk to the heart of PDC so if you are not into walking then this is not for you. With your room you also get a continental breakfast, toast, coffee and juice. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone that wants to be out of the way of the noise and is not bothered by a good walk.
reviews.title: Cute Hotel
Favorite hotel
reviews.text: I have stayed at this small intimate hotel for years and it is the best as far as the staff and the cleanliness. I am heading back this friday. The only thing that I can say negative about this hotel is: Too many people have found out about it and it gets harder to book a room. Love Alfredo and his family, especially baby Melydia and his beautiful wife, Bertha. See ya this week my friends.

reviews.title: Sweet Spot
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent a week at this hotel. The price to performance ratio is very high here. The room was clean with air-conditioning and TV. It has a small but nice clean cool pool. The staff was outstanding! You even get a basic breakfast of Toast, OJ and Coffee no charge but due tip. Also, on the counters there are some Mexican pastries. You can order a bigger breakfast off the menu (very reasonable) They also have a PC w/Inet access. It's only one block from the end of 5th Ave. Which is the touristy area. There are lots of restaurants and shops on 5th Ave. We found some good cheap eats just down the road past the soccer field and a few blocks down I think it was 30th Ave. It’s a short walk to a beautiful beach with a small reef a stone's throw out. Bring your mask and snorkel! Mamita's beach club is affiliated with the hotel and you can get decent drinks with chips and salsa for around $10. There's even a shower, pool and clean restrooms at the beach club. Everyone seemed nice and we had no problems with banditos. We did have some friends to were pulled over in their rental car and had to pay the police $40 to forget the allege traffic violation. On 5th Ave. there was a police information center and you could lodge a complaint against the police if you wanted. We had no problems with the police or anyone else. There are also many fun things to do in the area or close by. Just outside Play Del Carmen there’s a great eco park call Xcaret. It’s an all day event that’s very fun if you like to snorkel, enjoy the natural tropical environment and animals and Mayan ceremonies this is a must do!

We spend 11 nights at the Riviera Caribe Maya in March and loved it. Short walk to the beach (and from what I could see, the best part of the beach), quiet end of town, just around the corner from 5th Avenue, nice helpful staff, beautiful pool, clean, great coffee and the best orange juice! We are so happy we did the trip this way and not an all-inclusive resort.
reviews.title: Couldn't have picked a better place!
Wonderful!
reviews.text: 10th Ave is a busy street and a bit noisy in the day and during breakfast but I would still return given all the positives. The continental breakfast can be added to very cheaply - ask for a menu, as it wasn't offered to us so we just asked for what we wanted (eggs or fruit for $3 u.s.) We had a standard plus room on the ground floor where we could walk out to the pool, which was wonderful. Room had a safe, fridge, fan, ac, small tv. The room could have used a second mirror as the sink/closet/bathroom area was a bit cramped when 2 people are getting ready to go out. Free internet in the lobby.
Head to Walmart, yes there is a Walmart and stock up on booze, water, pop, fruit, Mexican pastries and just about everything else. Taxi back to the hotel for about $2-3 u.s.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-good location

reviews.text: I couldn't believe how many restraunts there were in Playa. Our favs were Babes for Thai food and Don Mario (8th St & 10th Ave)for good steak, tequila prawns, and the spagetti was great too! Being on 10th Ave, Don Mario is a bit cheaper too.
reviews.title: Worth staying in
Perfect girls holiday
reviews.text: Would defintly stay at the Riviera Caribe Maya again.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.text: My new husband and I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon from July 16-24. I finally decided on this hotel after nearly a year of research on trip advisor for a good spot for our honeymoon. We got married in the morning and planned on leaving for Cancun Int'l in the afternoon. HOWEVER, Hurricane Emily was planning on landfall on the Mexican Riviera the NEXT DAY. We were quite nervous about flying head on into a major hurricane but we did it anyway(only around 20 passengers on our flight!!). After we arrived, on Sunday, there was a meeting for all the guests at the hotel (16!!) concerning how we were going to ride out the storm there at the hotel. Management provided us with some sandwiches, bottled water, a 5 gallon bucket of water for flushing the toilet, and a downstairs room during the storm. We stopped at a small store that afternoon and bought some chips, chex mix, and some muffins not knowing how long we would be without electricity,or food for that matter. The storm approached that afternoon with its worst fury between midnight and 2 a.m. We were without electricity from that point until Tuesday. Mexico sure is a hot place without some a/c and a shower!! And, we were without food by Monday night. Found a little place on 5th Ave. that had a propane tank hooked up to an oven to make pizza. We were so hungry by this time that we didn't care what it tasted like. It was a little strange to a girl from the Midwest--jicama, onion, and tomato w/some kind of white sauce. But, hey it was food!! The electricity came back Tues. morning. The staff at this hotel immediately started cleaning up after the storm was over. There was quite a lot of debris throughout Playa. But, the locals worked tirelessly to get their town back to normal for the tourists. Only a couple of days and you hardly knew that a major hurricane had just been through the area. Kudos to those workers.

The hotel was in a good location...away from all the craziness on 5th Ave. Plus, being so close to Mamitas was great since it was so HOT!! Our hotel was always clean and cool with a great air conditioner and ceiling fan. Breakfast was good, too. We usually ordered off of the menu since we like a hearty breakfast each day. It was inexpensive and the staff was very attentive to our needs. The resident turtle there at the hotel liked to come by our table each morning for a piece of melon. Cracked us up.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!
Just what I was looking for
reviews.text: The beach was awesome...even though the hurricane washed away a lot of the sand. The water was absolutely beautiful!! After missing out on a few days of good beach weather due to the hurricane, we pretty much resigned ourselves to beach bums the remainder of our trip. Only 4 days to enjoy the beach but, hey, it was worth it. Aside from some jellyfish stings, fire ant bites, I still got a great tan and some awesome pictures. Also, Mamitas only honors the beach passes from the hotel from Sun.-Thurs. The rest of the week, you have to pay full price ($6). But, it was worth it to us to have a palapa and 2 loungers.

reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay
reviews.text: I loved this hotel, Playa del Carmen, and the hospitable people that live there!! I would love to go back someday. Maybe do some sightseeing. For only $60/night you can't beat this hotel for all that you get with it! Enjoy your stay!!

reviews.title: If you are single-don't go with one person!
reviews.text: We recently returned from a trip to Playa Del Carmen and loved our stay at Riveria Caribe Maya. Many attributes of this hotel exceeded our expectations. The hotel has an excellent location - north of the crowded areas of 5th Avenue and very close to Mamita's Beach Club. We loved Mamita's too. Everyone there was extremely friendly and beach ws gorgegous.

reviews.title: Good deal. Nice hotel.
reviews.text: Pros: very reasonaby priced. Very friendly staff. Very clean. Vouchers for a beautiful beach situated at about 4min walking distance. Pretty typical of Mexican style decoration, yet comfortable and well maintained. One block from 5th street which is where most of the restaurants and the action is a night.

reviews.title: Can't beat it!
reviews.text: Cons: a little noisy as it is right on a "fairly" passing street (10th street) and with the soccer field accross the street.

reviews.title: A great spot in Playa
reviews.text: If you don't spend a lot of time at your hotel and would rather spend your day at the beach, scuba diving or sightseeing, that's a great value with great service. The pool is small, but the beach is nearby. Will recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Can't entirely agree.
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two weeks.The staff are friendly and helpfull.The rooms although small are clean and there is 24hr security.
We travelled up to Cancun and stockpiled some great wine from Costco and were set for the 2 weeks.
